string.text: Do you really want to leave the game?
Connection error: this CD-Key is already in use
Connection error: your CD-Key is blocked; contact support

A new patch is available.
Version: %s
%s
Do you want to download it now?
Only one active vote is allowed
Damn it... Bricked in by demons! There was an exit... Maybe I should wait?...
Keep your water flask in a belt pouch.
Check your rig and pouches before heading out.
Using buckshot at long range is just wasting ammo.
You can keep a pistol in the binocular case too, just in case.
Poor health won’t let you move fast, get treated.
Before sleeping, stow your weapon in the backpack and take off your suit — it’s more comfortable that way.
Save on a dosimeter, and you’ll pay extra for treatment.
The Zone isn’t a park — move carefully and stay alert.
The Zone isn’t a stadium — you walk here, not run… at least until a pack of mutants picks up your trail.
If you don’t see a mutant, it doesn’t mean it’s not there.
Don’t spray ammo from the hip, or you’ll end up with a leaky head.
A zombie won’t spare you — it’ll starve you to death without mercy.
Even a short trip in the Zone can feel like an eternity — be prepared.
Heading out for a day? Pack supplies for a week.
Rocks and buildings aren’t just scenery — sometimes they’re your only chance to survive.
Don’t chase loot! Greed is the leading cause of death in the Zone.
If everything’s going too smoothly, be ready — the Zone will soon screw you over.
A real friend isn’t the one who says so, but the one who backs words with actions.
Don’t rely on your rifle alone — keep a pistol handy. Two weapons are better than one.
If you’re hungry, eat — makes you harder to eat yourself.
Sometimes it’s better to walk past loot than to lose your life chasing it.
A fool fires in bursts, a wise man fires single shots… though sometimes it’s the other way around.
Not too hungry? Hold on — don’t eat your last loaf, it might save you from starvation.
Instead of rushing around for artifacts, see if it’s easier to cook what you need.
A bad reputation isn’t a turnip — you can’t just pull it out and toss it away.
One stupid act can erase a hundred good ones!
If you signed up for a job and can’t finish it, tell the client — don’t wait for it to sort itself out.
The dead don’t care, but their supplies might save your life.
The “Black Mark” is a parasite that feeds on your life.
With the “Black Mark”, stay away from inhabited places — it’ll die off faster.
While you sleep, the “Black Mark” sleeps too and doesn’t wear out.
Nothing stays hidden in the Zone — screw someone over and everyone will know.
No one deals with maniacs who shoot at everything that moves.
Run into a mutant pack — don’t fuss over your loot! Drop the backpack and run.
A campfire clears your head — always carry spare matches.
Want to shoot more accurately? Crouch, catch your breath, and take your time.
Shooting fast without thinking? You won’t live long.
Making plans for tomorrow? Don’t make the Zone laugh.
Planning means thinking about what could go wrong tomorrow.
The deeper you go into the Zone, the harder it is to breathe! Always bring a suit with a gas mask.
Even a cracked mask is better than none at all.
Grime on your mask can only be washed off with clean water.
Dry kindling catches faster. In the rain, out in the open, you can burn through a whole box of matches.
Take care of your gear! You won’t carry much in rags.
You can never have too much vodka! It’s medicine, protection, and currency.
Blind dogs mess with your head? Take a swig of vodka and you’ll feel better.
Treated yourself with too much vodka? Chug an energy drink — it’ll pass.
Drinking vodka on an empty stomach harms your health! If you treated yourself — eat something.
There are no friends in the Zone! If they don’t shoot you in the back — be thankful.
Caught the “Black Mark”? Don’t panic — it’ll die on its own if you don’t try to get rid of it.
You can’t wipe out all the mutants… no matter how hard you try.
Cowards die first. Heroes die second! Decide who you are.
Don’t charge in head-on! Look around — there’s always a quiet way through.
Hear a shot — duck. Feel the ground shaking — jump!
Excuses don’t interest anyone! Fail a task, and you lose trust.
Before a long trip, rest well and get proper sleep.
Bad artifacts are more profitable to trade or cook than to sell.
Dropping your backpack lets you jump higher and escape mutants.
Being ready to negotiate with anyone makes survival easier — enemies included.
Plan your route carefully and choose the right weapon for the job.
Don’t forget to maintain your weapons. A misfire in combat can cost you your life.
You cannot run Renderer-2 on your computer
attach %s to %s in the first slot
attach %s to %s in the second slot
Fuel is required at the Bar.
E Q U I P M E N T
L O A D O U T
